myths-or-facts.question: The Meta logo signifies the infinity loop that symbolizes endless possibilities and endless universes.
The first OCP Summit was in June 2014.
myths-or-facts.comment: The first OCP Summit was in June, 2011 with roughly 200 attendees who gathered on Meta campus

myths-or-facts.question: The four core OCP tenets are Effciency, Scalability, Openness and Impact.
OCP requires that all contibutions meet at least one out of four of the core OCP tenets; Effciency, Scalability, Openness and Impact.
myths-or-facts.comment: To insure a level of consistency in our contributions, OCP requires that all contributions meet three out of the four core OCP tenets

myths-or-facts.question: The Bay Area has the highest number of data centers in the US
myths-or-facts.comment: (source: Usitc) Dallas has the highest number of data centers in the US

myths-or-facts.question: About 2% of the total energy in the US is used by data centers
The largest data center in the world is the Range International Information Group, located in Langfang, China.
myths-or-facts.comment: (source: datacenters.com ) It occupies a space of 6.3 million square feet!

myths-or-facts.question: The countries that have the most data centers in 2022 are the US, Germany, UK, China, and Canada.
Meta's first data center was opened in Altoona, Pennsylvania in 2011
myths-or-facts.comment: The first Meta data center was opened in 2011 in Prineville, Oregon.

myths-or-facts.question: Over 100 billion Whatsapp messages are sent everyday day
myths-or-facts.comment: In typical whatsapp fashion, why send 1 message, when you can send 5?

myths-or-facts.question: The Apple Inc logo is a tribute to the late, Alan Turing.
myths-or-facts.comment: Unfortunately, the truth is far less grand. The company is called Apple purely because Steve Jobs thought it sounded like a nice word, and because Jobs was in the middle of an all-fruit diet when he thought of it.

myths-or-facts.question: San Jose was once the capital of California
myths-or-facts.comment: San Jose was California's first city. It was also the state capital from 1849 to 1852.

myths-or-facts.question: Spending on data center systems worldwide reached $137 billion in 2021.
myths-or-facts.comment: Spending on data center systems worldwide actually reached $237 billion in 2021., (Source: Statista)

myths-or-facts.question: The first computer was invented by Charles Babbage
The internet was invented by Tim Berners-Lee
myths-or-facts.comment: Computer scientists Vinton Cerf and Bob Kahn are credited with inventing the Internet communication protocols we use today. The online world then took on a more recognizable form in 1990, when computer scientist Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web

myths-or-facts.question: Python programming language was created by Guido van Rossum
In the 1960s, General Electric developed the very first direct liquid cooling system
myths-or-facts.comment: Liquid cooling began with IBM announcing their first water cooled product in 1964.

myths-or-facts.question: Facebook Inc was founded in 2001
The 2Africa subsea communications cable is the world's longest, stretching ~28,000 miles
myths-or-facts.comment: Not quite. It will be the longest when complete, but until then, SEA-ME-WE3, is currently the longest at 24,000 miles.

myths-or-facts.question: Ada Lovelace published the first computer algorithm.
myths-or-facts.comment: Lovelace worked on Charles Babbage's computer "The Analytical Engine" and is regarded as the first computer programmer.

sustainability.question: Out of all available electricity today, how much electricity do data centers consume globally?
sustainability.comment: it is estimated that the world's data centers use 2-3% of all available electricity today

sustainability.question: Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) is a way to measure use in Data Centers using what equation?
sustainability.answers: IT Equipment Power / Total Facility Power, Total  CO2 Emissioned Caused / IT Equipment Power, Total Facility Power / IT Equipment Power, CO2 Emitted / Unit of Energy (kWh)
sustainability.answer: Total Facility Power / IT Equipment Power
sustainability.comment: Sometimes referred to as 'Power Utilization Effectiveness', this ratio describes how much extra energy a data center needs to maintain IT equipment for every watt delivered to the equipment. The best PUE a data center can have is 1: an ideal situation, with no extra energy use.

sustainability.question: Worldwide, data centers account for what percentage of global greenhouse emissions?
Data center buildings Meta completed in 2021 exhibit a Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) of 1.09 and Water Usage Effectiveness (WUE) of 0.26
Meta has committed to reaching net zero emissions across our value chain in 2040
sustainability.comment: Meta has committed to reaching net zero emissions across our value chain in 2030

sustainability.question: Meta has committed to becoming water positive by 2030
What percentage of US data centers are LEED certified (Leadership in Energy & Environmental Design)?
sustainability.comment: Only around 5% of all US data Centers are LEED certified

sustainability.question: Which of the following is not a metric used to measure data center sustainability?
sustainability.answers: Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE), Carbon Usage Effectiveness (CUE), Water Usage Effectiveness (WUE), Electronics Usage Efficiency (EUE)
sustainability.comment: Electronics Usage Efficiency is not a metric used to measure  data center sustainability but Electronics Disposal Efficiency (EDE) is.

sustainability.question: According to The International Energy Agency, by 2025 data centers will consume what percentage of the world's power supply?
sustainability.comment: The International Energy Agency estimates that by 2025, data centers will consume 1/5 of the world's power supply.

sustainability.question: Nitrous oxide remains in the atmosphere for up to 120 years and methane for up to 10 years, but how long does CO2 remain in the atmosphere?
sustainability.answers: up to 200 years, up to 500 years, up to 700 years, up to 1,000 years
sustainability.comment: Worryingly, CO2 remains in the, atmosphere for up to 1,000, years

sustainability.question: 40% of the global population lacks access to clean and safe drinking water.
Which of the following materials cannot be infinitely recycled?
sustainability.comment: Paper can be recycled, but only between 5-7 times and each time with a lower grade product.

sustainability.question: Landscaping accounts for about half the water Californians use at home
sustainability.comment: Showers account for another 18 percent, while toilets use about 20 percent.

sustainability.question: What percentage of the Earth's water is fit and available for consumption?
sustainability.comment: While 3% of the Earth's water is fresh, only 0.5% of the Earth's water is fit and available for consumption. The remaining portion is either inaccessible, in ice caps, glaciers, or underground, or too polluted for people to salvage.

sustainability.question: Which of the following is the 'greenest' form of energy?
sustainability.comment: Considering the emissions associated with their manufacture and installation, Hydro power has the lowest carbon footprint

sustainability.question: Which country relies the most on nuclear energy?
sustainability.comment: While the United States has the most operating nuclear reactors, France relies the most on nuclear energy with over 70% of its power produced from nuclear sources.

sustainability.question: Which US State produces the most wind power?
sustainability.comment: Texas. Generating over 92 Terawatt-hours of electricity during a year, more than the next three top states (Iowa, Oklahoma, and Kansas) combined.

sustainability.question: Which US State produces the most solar power?
sustainability.comment: California remains the king of solar energy, with a capacity of 32,394 MW—the equivalent of 8,430,324 homes powered by solar.,

sustainability.question: Which US State produces the most hydropower?
In 2022, which country in the world was the most energy efficient?
sustainability.answers: United Kingdom, France, The Netherlands, Germany
sustainability.comment: According to the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy (ACEEE), France rose to the top due to policies such as the bonus-malus system

meta-pop-culture.question: Which Meta product has the highest monthly active users?
meta-pop-culture.comment: Facebook has nearly 3 billion monthy active users in 2022

meta-pop-culture.question: Apart from @instagram, which Instagram account has the most followers?
meta-pop-culture.answers: Justin Bieber, Kylie Jenner, Cristiano Ronaldo, Virat Kohli
meta-pop-culture.comment: Cristiano Ronaldo has 478 million followers on Instagram.

meta-pop-culture.question: Mark Zuckerberg graduated from Harvard in 2006
meta-pop-culture.comment: Mark never finished his undergrad but he later recieved an Honorary Doctor of Laws Degree from Harvard in 2017

meta-pop-culture.question: Before landing the name 'Facebook', what was the website called?
What is the most-watched live video on Facebook?
meta-pop-culture.answers: Chewbacca Mom, Fenton Dog, Charlie bit my finger, Road Marking Is an Artform
meta-pop-culture.comment: In just 5 days, the video showing Candace Payne trying on a Chewbacca mask racked up over 140million views and 3 million shares.

meta-pop-culture.question: What is the most-liked image on Instagram?
meta-pop-culture.answers: @cristiano @georginagio: Their twins pregnancy announcement, @world_record_egg: Photo of an egg, @xxxtentacion: Final post before his death, @arianagrande: Photos from her wedding with Dalton Gomez
meta-pop-culture.comment: With over 56.1 million likes, this photo of an egg clearly wins the top spot.

meta-pop-culture.question: Which country has the most Whatsapp users?
meta-pop-culture.comment: India has over 390.1 millon whatsapp users

meta-pop-culture.question: Apart from Facebook App, which of the following Facebook pages is the most followed?
meta-pop-culture.answers: Mr Bean, Cristiano Ronaldo, 5-minute Crafts, Samsung
meta-pop-culture.comment: The Samsung facebook page has over 161 million followers.

meta-pop-culture.question: Zuck's dog is a well-loved, honorary teammate of Meta, but what is his name?
meta-pop-culture.comment: Beast is a Puli and the master of disguise

meta-pop-culture.question: Out of the following, who is not a founder of Facebook?
meta-pop-culture.answers: Eduardo Saverin, Peter Thiel, Dustin Moskovitz, Chris Hughes
meta-pop-culture.comment: Peter Thiel was not a founder but Facebook's first investor.

meta-pop-culture.question: Which of the following is not a reaction available on Facebook?
meta-pop-culture.comment: Instead of "Dislike" we have "Angry" and "Sad" reactions

meta-pop-culture.question: The 'Poke' feature has been available on Facebook since 2004
meta-pop-culture.comment: And no, we still aren't sure what it means, either.

meta-pop-culture.question: Thefacebook's original logo was Al Pacino's face
meta-pop-culture.comment: Al Pacino's face was superimposed with binary numbers as Facebook's original logo and was designed by co-founder Andrew McCollum

meta-pop-culture.question: What was the name of the first consumer Oculus device?
meta-pop-culture.comment: The Oculus Rift was released in 2016 and still required tethering to a computer.

meta-pop-culture.question: Facebook messenger is the most popular messenging app globally
meta-pop-culture.comment: With over 2 Billion users, Whatsapp is the most popular messenging app in the world.

meta-pop-culture.question: What is Meta Connect?
meta-pop-culture.answers: The connection between Instagram and Messenger app, An internal Meta term for a meeting, Annual event Meta uses to showcase progress and plans related to the metaverse, The name of our Network backbone
meta-pop-culture.answer: Annual event Meta uses to showcase progress and plans related to the metaverse
meta-pop-culture.comment: We had it last week! re-watch on metaconnect.com

meta-pop-culture.question: What are the Ray-Ban X Meta Smartglasses called?
meta-pop-culture.comment: Ray-Ban Stories allow you to take photos and videos, listen to music and calls, and share content directly to your social media channels

meta-pop-culture.question: Which of the following is not a piece of hardware that Meta has collaborated on or launched in its company's history?
meta-pop-culture.answers: Mobile Phone, Smart Glasses, Drone, Video Doorbell

meta-pop-culture.question: In what year did Facebook reach 1 Billion monthly active users?
meta-pop-culture.comment: Just 3 years later, Facebook had 1 billion active users in a single day.

meta-pop-culture.question: What was the name of Meta's solar-powered drone?

our-infrastructure.question: Meta's Hardware Engineering team names most of its hardware after what?
our-infrastructure.comment: National Parks are a popular choice

our-infrastructure.question: What was the name of Meta's first in-house designed server?
our-infrastructure.comment: Symbolizing our new endeavor in the DC hardware space.

our-infrastructure.question: How many Data Center locations does Meta have around the world?
our-infrastructure.comment: We currently have 21 locations with 13 data centers online.

our-infrastructure.question: Our AI compute platform is named after which National Park?
Our data center buildings are big, they are about the size of what?
our-infrastructure.answers: Empire State Building (~1,250ft), 3 Boeing 747s (~750ft), 7 Blue Whales (~700ft), Nimitz Class Aircraft carrier (~1,50ft)
our-infrastructure.comment: Just a little shorter than the Empire State Building!

our-infrastructure.question: When completed, the 2Africa Subsea Cable will be the longest in the world. How long will it be when completed?
our-infrastructure.comment: It will be 28,000 miles when complete. SEA-ME-WE3 is currently the longest at 24,000 miles.

our-infrastructure.question: What makes our Singapore Data center unique compared to our other data centers?
our-infrastructure.answers: It is multi-story, It is the largest, It requires no onsite staff, It is located on water
our-infrastructure.comment: It will be 11 floors tall when complete.

our-infrastructure.question: What was our first data center?
our-infrastructure.answers: Altoona Iowa, Prineville Oregon, Fortworth Texas, Clonee Ireland

our-infrastructure.question: All of Meta's Data Centers are supported by 100% renewable energy.
Which of Meta's Data centers is the largest?
our-infrastructure.answers: Altoona Iowa, Prineville Oregon, Singapore Clonee, Ireland

our-infrastructure.question: What does lime green color on hardware designs indicate?
our-infrastructure.answers: It is a Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), It is fully recyclable, It is a purchased component, It is safe to touch

our-infrastructure.question: Our current data center footprint sits around 30 million square feet.
our-infrastructure.comment: It is actually around 50 million square feet

our-infrastructure.question: Our AI systems can translate how many languages?
We recently open-sourced our machine-learning framework; what is it called?
How many data centers do we have in Asia?
our-infrastructure.comment: Singapore is our first and currently only DC location in Asia

our-infrastructure.question: What is Minipack2?
our-infrastructure.answers: Top of Rack Switch, Server Chassis, Optic Cable, Fabric Switch

our-infrastructure.question: In our hardware, what does RPU stand for?
our-infrastructure.answers: Revenue Per User, Routing Process Unit, Resevoir Pumping Unit, Related Product Unit
our-infrastructure.comment: Part of our Air Assisted Liquid Cooling solution

our-infrastructure.question: In our hardware, what does SCM stand for?
our-infrastructure.answers: Supply Chain Management, Switch Control Module, Software Configuration Manager, Source Code Module

our-infrastructure.question: How many minutes can the increased battery backup system supply power during outage events?
our-infrastructure.answers: Up to 2 minutes, Up to 4 minutes, Up to 6 minutes, Up to 8 minute
our-infrastructure.comment: We increased the performance of the Battery Backup (BBU) module to a 4 minute capacity compared to 90 seconds in its predecessor

our-infrastructure.question: How many liters of coolant is the Liquid Cooling Cart capable of handling at any given time?
